content:
Add a Select Input Element to a FlexCard

Add a Select Input element on a FlexCard to enable users to select an item from a dropdown list. Configure properties, custom attributes, add an action, and add conditions.

From the FlexCards tab, click a version of a FlexCard to open the FlexCard Designer.
From the Build panel, click Inputs, and drag the Select element onto the canvas.
Configure properties common to all Input elements:

* In Field Binding, bind the value of the input element to an existing or new data field.
* In Field Label, enter the label that appears next to the element.
* In Placeholder, enter temporary text that displays inside the input field.
* Check Required if the user must enter or select a value for this input element.
* Check Read-only to disable the ability to modify the input values.

Configure options:

* Click + Add New in the Options section.
* Label: Enter the visible label for the option.
* Value: Enter the value of the option.

Configure custom attributes and add conditions as needed.
title: Adding a Select Input Element to a FlexCard
